CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 16 Since the open circuit voltage V oc of BHJ PSCs is correlated to the difference between the LUMO energy level of the acceptor and HOMO energy level of the donor polymer , 5,17 therefore a higher V oc for PSFDTBT based polymer solar cells is anticipated due to the low - lying HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

1. BHJ PSCs: Blends of Hole Transporting and Electron Transporting materials in Bulk Heterojunction Photovoltaic Solar Cells.
2. V oc: Open circuit voltage.
3. BHJ PSCs: Contains the donor polymer.
4. Donor polymer: In this context, it is PSFDTBT.
5. LUMO energy level: Energy level of the Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital of the acceptor material.
6. HOMO energy level: Energy level of the Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital of the donor polymer.
7. PSFDTBT: A specific type of donor polymer.

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are: BHJ PSCs, donor polymer (PSFDTBT), LUMO energy level, and HOMO energy level.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Donor polymer: PSFDTBT

So, the only Material Name entity in the paragraph is the donor polymer (PSFDTBT).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 16 Since the open circuit voltage V oc of BHJ PSCs is correlated to the difference between the LUMO energy level of the acceptor and HOMO energy level of the donor polymer , 5,17 therefore a higher V oc for PSFDTBT based polymer solar cells is anticipated due to the low - lying HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

1. V oc (Open circuit voltage)
2. BHJ PSCs (Blends of High Performance Organic Semiconductors in Polymer Solar Cells)
3. LUMO energy level (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital energy level)
4. acceptor (Acceptor material in the BHJ PSCs)
5. HOMO energy level (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital energy level)
6. donor polymer (Donor material in the BHJ PSCs)
7. PSFDTBT based polymer (Polymer with the abbreviation PSFDTBT)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. V oc (Open circuit voltage)
2. LUMO energy level
3. HOMO energy level
4. PSFDTBT based polymer (Polymer with the abbreviation PSFDTBT)

These are the material properties mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Open circuit voltage (V oc) |
| LUMO energy level |
| HOMO energy level |
| PSFDTBT based polymer (Polymer with the abbreviation PSFDTBT) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 16 Since the open circuit voltage V oc of BHJ PSCs is correlated to the difference between the LUMO energy level of the acceptor and HOMO energy level of the donor polymer , 5,17 therefore a higher V oc for PSFDTBT based polymer solar cells is anticipated due to the low - lying HOMO energy level.

Let's think step by step.

1. Open circuit voltage (V oc)
2. Energy level of the acceptor (LUMO energy level)
3. Energy level of the donor polymer (HOMO energy level)
4. Energy level of PSFDTBT based polymer (implied but not explicitly stated)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Open circuit voltage (V oc)
2. LUMO energy level
3. HOMO energy level
4. Energy level of PSFDTBT based polymer (implicitly related to its material properties)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Open circuit voltage (V oc) |
| LUMO energy level |
| HOMO energy level |
| Energy level of PSFDTBT based polymer |

Note: Since the energy level of PSFDTBT based polymer is not explicitly stated as a value but is related to material properties, it is included for completeness but its value is not provided in the paragraph.
